historySnippet.reasoning: A is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0040) while D is starting to slip, so keep U at the proven best (0.10) and make a small stabilizing nudge to prevent diversity collapse without disrupting the high-agency regime seen near the best-record params.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and currently rising (dA/dt=+0.0036) while Complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the small C drift by minimally reducing k_C_decay without disturbing the high-D regime (history shows larger multi-param shifts can hurt A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0), and since the best record occurred at U=0.10 with similar params, I’ll keep U steady and make a small calculated reduction to k_A_decay to better sustain near-max A without destabilizing C/D (recent k_A_decay tweaks showed mixed but sometimes positive effects).

A is already >0.75 and rising but C and D are drifting down, so keep U at the best-record 0.10 and apply a small stabilization tweak (lower k_C_decay, slightly raise k_CD, and slightly reduce k_D_decay) to arrest C/D collapse without disrupting the proven high-A regime.

Agency is already at 1.0 but drifting down slightly (dA/dt=-0.0005) while complexity is decaying (dC/dt=-0.0037), so keep U at the best-record value (0.10) and counter the fade by reducing A-decay and slightly reducing C-decay to stabilize C→A support without harming high diversity (history shows lowering k_A_decay previously improved A).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and near-best (A=0.9990) with the same U as the best record, but C is decaying (dC/dt=-0.0056), so I’ll keep U at 0.10 while slightly reducing k_C_decay to stabilize complexity without risking the small A gains seen after recent k_C_decay tuning (e.g., Gen 4104/4178).

A is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt=-0.0004), so to stabilize near-peak agency without disrupting the best-known regime (U=0.10), I’ll keep U fixed and reduce k_A_decay slightly (a lever that previously improved A at Gen 3933.8 and 4140.0).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt=0.0051) while C is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and nudge complexity support by slightly reducing k_C_decay (which historically improved A at Gen 4104/4250) without perturbing diversity pressure (k_DU stays 0).

Agency is already at the ceiling (A=1.0) but dA/dt is slightly negative; to arrest the fade without risking a diversity crash (D≈1.0, k_DU already 0), keep U at the proven best (0.10) and slightly reduce k_A_decay (prior k_A_decay tweaks had large impact, incl. a big drop at Gen 4281.0), while leaving diversity/complexity drivers unchanged.

Agency is already at 1.0 but dA/dt is slightly negative, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the fade by reducing k_A_decay further (prior k_A_decay tweaks sometimes hurt, so keep the change minimal) while preserving high C and D.

name: Decaying-Complexity Agency Skater
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by repeatedly tuning its internal decay channels rather than relying on environmental coupling: multiple reductions/adjustments to complexity decay (k_C_decay) produced consistent agency gains, while late-stage tweaks to agency decay (k_A_decay) often destabilized it and caused dips. In a low-difficulty habitat (U=0.10) with no direct diversity-from-environment boost (k_DU=0), it maintained very high diversity (0.993) and near-max complexity (0.910), effectively “skating” agency upward by balancing C↔D coupling (k_CD=0.5) and keeping A-loss minimal (k_A_decay=0.0005) until it finally surpassed the prior best (A≈1.000).
